items.name: Ext.dd.DDProxy
items.text:
A DragDrop implementation that inserts an empty, bordered div into
the document that follows the cursor during drag operations.  At the time of
the click, the frame div is resized to the dimensions of the linked html
element, and moved to the exact location of the linked element.

References to the "frame" element refer to the single proxy element that
was created to be dragged in place of all DDProxy elements on the
page.

items.name: _resizeProxy
items.text:
The proxy is automatically resized to the dimensions of the linked
element when a drag is initiated, unless resizeFrame is set to false

items.name: addInvalidHandleClass
items.text: Lets you specify a css class of elements that will not initiate a drag

items.name: cssClass
items.text: the class of the elements you wish to ignore

items.name: addInvalidHandleId
items.text:
Lets you to specify an element id for a child of a drag handle
that should not initiate a drag

items.name: id
items.text: the element id of the element you wish to ignore

items.name: addInvalidHandleType
items.text:
Allows you to specify a tag name that should not start a drag operation
when clicked.  This is designed to facilitate embedding links within a
drag handle that do something other than start the drag.

items.name: tagName
items.text: the type of element to exclude

items.name: addToGroup
items.text:
Adds this instance to a group of related drag/drop objects.  All
instances belong to at least one group, and can belong to as many
groups as needed.

items.name: sGroup
items.text: the name of the group

items.name: alignElWithMouse
items.text:
Sets the element to the location of the mousedown or click event,
maintaining the cursor location relative to the location on the element
that was clicked.  Override this if you want to place the element in a
location other than where the cursor is.

items.name: el
items.text: the element to move

items.name: iPageX
items.text: the X coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

items.name: iPageY
items.text: the Y coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

items.name: applyConfig
items.text:
Sets up config options specific to this class. Overrides
Ext.dd.DragDrop, but all versions of this method through the
inheritance chain are called

items.name: autoOffset
items.text:
Sets the pointer offset to the distance between the linked element's top
left corner and the location the element was clicked.

items.name: iPageX
items.text: the X coordinate of the click

items.name: iPageY
items.text: the Y coordinate of the click

items.name: autoScroll
items.text:
Auto-scroll the window if the dragged object has been moved beyond the
visible window boundary.

items.name: x
items.text: the drag element's x position

items.name: y
items.text: the drag element's y position

items.name: h
items.text: the height of the drag element

items.name: w
items.text: the width of the drag element

items.name: b4Drag
items.text:
Event that fires prior to the onDrag event.  Overrides
Ext.dd.DragDrop.

items.name: b4DragDrop
items.text: Code that executes immediately before the onDragDrop event

items.name: b4DragOut
items.text: Code that executes immediately before the onDragOut event

items.name: b4DragOver
items.text: Code that executes immediately before the onDragOver event

items.name: b4EndDrag
items.text: Code that executes immediately before the endDrag event

items.name: b4MouseDown
items.text:
Event that fires prior to the onMouseDown event.  Overrides
Ext.dd.DragDrop.

items.name: b4StartDrag
items.text: Code that executes immediately before the startDrag event

items.name: cachePosition
items.text:
Saves the most recent position so that we can reset the constraints and
tick marks on-demand.  We need to know this so that we can calculate the
number of pixels the element is offset from its original position.

items.name: iPageX
items.text:
the current x position (this just makes it so we
don't have to look it up again)

items.name: iPageY
items.text:
the current y position (this just makes it so we
don't have to look it up again)

items.name: clearConstraints
items.text:
Clears any constraints applied to this instance.  Also clears ticks
since they can't exist independent of a constraint at this time.

items.name: clearTicks
items.text: Clears any tick interval defined for this instance

items.name: constrainTo
constrainTo
items.text: The element or element ID to constrain to.

items.name: pad
items.text:
(optional) Pad provides a way to specify "padding" of the constraints,
and can be either a number for symmetrical padding (4 would be equal to `{left:4, right:4, top:4, bottom:4}`) or
an object containing the sides to pad. For example: `{right:10, bottom:10}`

items.name: inContent
items.text: (optional) Constrain the draggable in the content box of the element (inside padding and borders)

items.name: constructor
items.text: Creates new DDProxy.

items.name: id
items.text: the id of the linked html element

items.name: sGroup
items.text: the group of related DragDrop objects

items.name: config
items.text:
an object containing configurable attributes.
Valid properties for DDProxy in addition to those in DragDrop:

- resizeFrame
- centerFrame
- dragElId

items.name: createFrame
items.text: Creates the proxy element if it does not yet exist

items.name: endDrag
items.text: Called when we are done dragging the object

items.name: e
items.text: the mouseup event

items.name: getDragEl
items.text:
Returns a reference to the actual element to drag.  By default this is
the same as the html element, but it can be assigned to another
element. An example of this can be found in Ext.dd.DDProxy
the html element

items.name: getEl
items.text: Returns a reference to the linked element
the html element

items.name: getTargetCoord
items.text:
Finds the location the element should be placed if we want to move
it to where the mouse location less the click offset would place us.

items.name: iPageX
items.text: the X coordinate of the click

items.name: iPageY
items.text: the Y coordinate of the click
An object that contains the coordinates (Object.x and Object.y)

items.name: getTick
items.text:
Normally the drag element is moved pixel by pixel, but we can specify
that it move a number of pixels at a time.  This method resolves the
location when we have it set up like this.

items.name: val
items.text: where we want to place the object

items.name: tickArray
items.text: sorted array of valid points
the closest tick

items.name: handleMouseDown
items.text: Called when this object is clicked

items.name: oDD
items.text: the clicked dd object (this dd obj)

items.name: handleOnAvailable
items.text: Executed when the linked element is available

items.name: init
items.text:
Sets up the DragDrop object.  Must be called in the constructor of any
Ext.dd.DragDrop subclass

items.name: id
items.text: the id of the linked element

items.name: sGroup
items.text: the group of related items

items.name: config
items.text: configuration attributes

items.name: initFrame
items.text:
Initialization for the drag frame element.  Must be called in the
constructor of all subclasses

items.name: initTarget
items.text:
Initializes Targeting functionality only... the object does not
get a mousedown handler.

items.name: id
items.text: the id of the linked element

items.name: sGroup
items.text: the group of related items

items.name: config
items.text: configuration attributes

items.name: isLocked
items.text:
Returns true if this instance is locked, or the drag drop mgr is locked
(meaning that all drag/drop is disabled on the page.)

true if this obj or all drag/drop is locked, else
false

items.name: isValidHandleChild
items.text: Checks the tag exclusion list to see if this click should be ignored

items.name: node
items.text: the HTMLElement to evaluate
true if this is a valid tag type, false if not

items.name: lock
items.text: Locks this instance

items.name: onAvailable
items.text:
Override the onAvailable method to do what is needed after the initial
position was determined.

items.name: onDrag
items.text:
Abstract method called during the onMouseMove event while dragging an
object.

items.name: e
items.text: the mousemove event

items.name: onDragDrop
items.text:
Abstract method called when this item is dropped on another DragDrop
obj

items.name: e
items.text: the mouseup event

items.name: id
items.text:
In POINT mode, the element
id this was dropped on.  In INTERSECT mode, an array of dd items this
was dropped on.

items.name: onDragEnter
items.text:
Abstract method called when this element fist begins hovering over
another DragDrop obj

items.name: e
items.text: the mousemove event

items.name: id
items.text:
In POINT mode, the element
id this is hovering over.  In INTERSECT mode, an array of one or more
dragdrop items being hovered over.

items.name: onDragOut
items.text: Abstract method called when we are no longer hovering over an element

items.name: e
items.text: the mousemove event

items.name: id
items.text:
In POINT mode, the element
id this was hovering over.  In INTERSECT mode, an array of dd items
that the mouse is no longer over.

items.name: onDragOver
items.text:
Abstract method called when this element is hovering over another
DragDrop obj

items.name: e
items.text: the mousemove event

items.name: id
items.text:
In POINT mode, the element
id this is hovering over.  In INTERSECT mode, an array of dd items
being hovered over.

items.name: onInvalidDrop
items.text:
Abstract method called when this item is dropped on an area with no
drop target

items.name: e
items.text: the mouseup event

items.name: onMouseDown
items.text: Called when a drag/drop obj gets a mousedown

items.name: e
items.text: the mousedown event

items.name: onMouseUp
items.text: Called when a drag/drop obj gets a mouseup

items.name: e
items.text: the mouseup event

items.name: removeFromGroup
items.text: Removes this instance from the supplied interaction group

items.name: sGroup
items.text: The group to drop

items.name: removeInvalidHandleClass
items.text: Unsets an invalid css class

items.name: cssClass
items.text:
the class of the element(s) you wish to
re-enable

items.name: removeInvalidHandleId
items.text: Unsets an invalid handle id

items.name: id
items.text: the id of the element to re-enable

items.name: removeInvalidHandleType
items.text: Unsets an excluded tag name set by addInvalidHandleType

items.name: tagName
items.text: the type of element to unexclude

items.name: resetConstraints
items.text: Must be called if you manually reposition a dd element.

items.name: setDelta
items.text:
Sets the pointer offset.  You can call this directly to force the
offset to be in a particular location (e.g., pass in 0,0 to set it
to the center of the object)

items.name: iDeltaX
items.text: the distance from the left

items.name: iDeltaY
items.text: the distance from the top

items.name: setDragElId
items.text:
Allows you to specify that an element other than the linked element
will be moved with the cursor during a drag

items.name: id
items.text: the id of the element that will be used to initiate the drag

items.name: setDragElPos
items.text:
Sets the drag element to the location of the mousedown or click event,
maintaining the cursor location relative to the location on the element
that was clicked.  Override this if you want to place the element in a
location other than where the cursor is.

items.name: iPageX
items.text: the X coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

items.name: iPageY
items.text: the Y coordinate of the mousedown or drag event

items.name: setHandleElId
items.text:
Allows you to specify a child of the linked element that should be
used to initiate the drag operation.  An example of this would be if
you have a content div with text and links.  Clicking anywhere in the
content area would normally start the drag operation.  Use this method
to specify that an element inside of the content div is the element
that starts the drag operation.

items.name: id
items.text:
the id of the element that will be used to
initiate the drag.

items.name: setInitPosition
items.text: Stores the initial placement of the linked element.

items.name: diffX
items.text: the X offset, default 0

items.name: diffY
items.text: the Y offset, default 0

items.name: setOuterHandleElId
items.text:
Allows you to set an element outside of the linked element as a drag
handle

items.name: id
items.text: the id of the element that will be used to initiate the drag

items.name: setPadding
items.text:
Configures the padding for the target zone in px.  Effectively expands
(or reduces) the virtual object size for targeting calculations.
Supports css-style shorthand; if only one parameter is passed, all sides
will have that padding, and if only two are passed, the top and bottom
will have the first param, the left and right the second.

items.name: iTop
items.text: Top pad

items.name: iRight
items.text: Right pad

items.name: iBot
items.text: Bot pad

items.name: iLeft
items.text: Left pad

items.name: setStartPosition
items.text:
Sets the start position of the element.  This is set when the obj
is initialized, the reset when a drag is started.

items.name: pos
items.text: current position (from previous lookup)

items.name: setXConstraint
items.text:
By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Use
this method to limit the horizontal travel of the element.  Pass in
0,0 for the parameters if you want to lock the drag to the y axis.

items.name: iLeft
items.text: the number of pixels the element can move to the left

items.name: iRight
items.text:
the number of pixels the element can move to the
right

items.name: iTickSize
items.text:
(optional) parameter for specifying that the
element should move iTickSize pixels at a time.

items.name: setXTicks
items.text:
Creates the array of horizontal tick marks if an interval was specified
in setXConstraint().

items.name: setYConstraint
items.text:
By default, the element can be dragged any place on the screen.  Set
this to limit the vertical travel of the element.  Pass in 0,0 for the
parameters if you want to lock the drag to the x axis.

items.name: iUp
items.text: the number of pixels the element can move up

items.name: iDown
items.text: the number of pixels the element can move down

items.name: iTickSize
items.text:
(optional) parameter for specifying that the
element should move iTickSize pixels at a time.

items.name: setYTicks
items.text:
Creates the array of vertical tick marks if an interval was specified in
setYConstraint().

items.name: showFrame
items.text:
Resizes the drag frame to the dimensions of the clicked object, positions
it over the object, and finally displays it

items.name: iPageX
items.text: X click position

items.name: iPageY
items.text: Y click position

items.name: startDrag
items.text:
Abstract method called after a drag/drop object is clicked
and the drag or mousedown time thresholds have beeen met.

items.name: x
items.text: X click location

items.name: y
items.text: Y click location

items.name: toString
items.text: toString method
string representation of the dd obj

items.name: unlock
items.text: Unlocks this instace

items.name: unreg
items.text: Removes all drag and drop hooks for this element

items.name: __ygDragDrop
items.text: Internal typeof flag

items.name: _domRef
items.text: Cached reference to the linked element

items.name: available
items.text: The available property is false until the linked dom element is accessible.

items.name: centerFrame
items.text:
By default the frame is positioned exactly where the drag element is, so
we use the cursor offset provided by Ext.dd.DD.  Another option that works only if
you do not have constraints on the obj is to have the drag frame centered
around the cursor.  Set centerFrame to true for this effect.

items.name: config
items.text: Configuration attributes passed into the constructor

items.name: constrainX
items.text: Set to true when horizontal contraints are applied

items.name: constrainY
items.text: Set to true when vertical contraints are applied

items.name: defaultPadding
items.text: Provides default constraint padding to "constrainTo" elements.

items.name: dragElId
items.text:
The id of the element that will be dragged.  By default this is same
as the linked element, but could be changed to another element. Ex:
Ext.dd.DDProxy

items.name: groups
items.text:
The group defines a logical collection of DragDrop objects that are
related.  Instances only get events when interacting with other
DragDrop object in the same group.  This lets us define multiple
groups using a single DragDrop subclass if we want.

An object in the format {'group1':true, 'group2':true}

items.name: handleElId
items.text:
The ID of the element that initiates the drag operation.  By default
this is the linked element, but could be changed to be a child of this
element.  This lets us do things like only starting the drag when the
header element within the linked html element is clicked.

items.name: hasOuterHandles
items.text:
By default, drags can only be initiated if the mousedown occurs in the
region the linked element is.  This is done in part to work around a
bug in some browsers that mis-report the mousedown if the previous
mouseup happened outside of the window.  This property is set to true
if outer handles are defined. Defaults to false.

items.name: id
items.text:
The id of the element associated with this object.  This is what we
refer to as the "linked element" because the size and position of
this element is used to determine when the drag and drop objects have
interacted.

items.name: ignoreSelf
items.text:
Set to false to enable a DragDrop object to fire drag events while dragging
over its own Element. Defaults to true - DragDrop objects do not by default
fire drag events to themselves.

items.name: invalidHandleClasses
items.text: An Array of CSS class names for elements to be considered in valid as drag handles.

items.name: invalidHandleIds
invalidHandleTypes
isTarget
items.text:
By default, all instances can be a drop target.  This can be disabled by
setting isTarget to false.

items.name: locked
items.text:
Individual drag/drop instances can be locked.  This will prevent
onmousedown start drag.

items.name: maintainOffset
items.text:
Maintain offsets when we resetconstraints.  Set to true when you want
the position of the element relative to its parent to stay the same
when the page changes

items.name: maxX
items.text: The right constraint

items.name: maxY
items.text: The down constraint

items.name: minX
items.text: The left constraint

items.name: minY
items.text: The up constraint

items.name: moveOnly
items.text:
When set to true, other DD objects in cooperating DDGroups do not receive
notification events when this DD object is dragged over them.

items.name: padding
items.text:
The padding configured for this drag and drop object for calculating
the drop zone intersection with this object.
An array containing the 4 padding values: [top, right, bottom, left]

items.name: primaryButtonOnly
items.text:
By default the drag and drop instance will only respond to the primary
button click (left button for a right-handed mouse).  Set to true to
allow drag and drop to start with any mouse click that is propogated
by the browser

items.name: resizeFrame
items.text:
By default we resize the drag frame to be the same size as the element
we want to drag (this is to get the frame effect).  We can turn it off
if we want a different behavior.

items.name: scroll
items.text:
When set to true, the utility automatically tries to scroll the browser
window when a drag and drop element is dragged near the viewport boundary.

items.name: startPageX
items.text:
The linked element's absolute X position at the time the drag was
started

items.name: startPageY
items.text:
The linked element's absolute X position at the time the drag was
started

items.name: xTicks
items.text:
Array of pixel locations the element will snap to if we specified a
horizontal graduation/interval.  This array is generated automatically
when you define a tick interval.

items.name: yTicks
items.text:
Array of pixel locations the element will snap to if we specified a
vertical graduation/interval.  This array is generated automatically
when you define a tick interval.

items.name: dragElId
items.text: The default drag frame div id
